translation: the top of the scroll

source_sentence: 大唐三藏義淨奉　制譯
translation: Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Great Tang by Yijing Feng

source_sentence: 爾時薄伽梵在室羅筏城逝多林給孤獨園。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時婆索迦聚落，彼有長者名曰力軍，財如毘沙門天王，娶妻經久一無子息，便生愁念：「我今大富多有珍財，了無子息，一朝身死，以無後嗣，財物沒官。」
translation: At the time, there was an elder from the village of Vāsuki named Rikṣuṇḍa who had wealth like the god Vaiśravaṇa. He had married a woman for a long time and had no children, so he became sad and thought, "Now, I'm very wealthy and have a lot of valuable possessions, but I have no children.

source_sentence: 親識知聞，咸來慰問：「何故如斯愁惱而住？」
translation: Relatives who know and hear about it all come to console him, "Why are you so worried and troubled?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「我無男女，恐身死後財物入官，是故憂耳。」
translation: He replied, "I don't have a man or woman, but I'm afraid my property will go to the government after I die, so I'm worried."

source_sentence: 諸親報曰：「應可祈請神祇，當得男女。」
translation: The relatives replied, "You can pray to the gods, and they will grant you a man and a woman."

source_sentence: 即便答曰：「若如是者，我當求請。」
translation: They quickly replied, "If that's the case, I will ask for one."

source_sentence: 為求子故，即便祈請大自在天、四大海神、毘沙門天、帝釋、梵王，諸天神等悉皆祈請求其男女，諸園林神、曠野等神、四衢道神、受祭神、同生神、同法神，常隨神等，悉皆求之。
translation: Even so, they prayed to the Mahêśvara gods, the four great sea deities, the Vaiśravaṇa gods, Indra, Brahmā, the gods of the gods, and others to ask for a son, and the gods of the garden, the wilderness, the four paths, the gods of acceptance of sacrifices, the gods of the same birth, the gods of the same dharma, and the gods of constant following all asked for them.

source_sentence: 諸人見彼祈請眾神，尚無男女，咸作是言：「若求天神，得男女者，世間諸人，求者皆得，便滿千子，如轉輪王，等無有異。」
translation: When people see that they've prayed to those gods, but there are no male or female yet, they all say, "If they ask a god of the gods and get a man or woman, then everyone in the world who asks for one will get one, and they'll be like the wheel-turning king with a thousand sons, and there'll be no difference between them."

source_sentence: 然由三事現前，方有男女。
translation: Still, it's because of three things that manifest before there are male and female.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 所為父母要有欲心和合一處、母月期至、中有現前，具此諸緣，方有子息。
translation: For a father and mother to have a place where their desires are unified, the mother's month is due, and there's a present, these are the conditions that make a child rest.

source_sentence: 然彼長者，為求男女祈請不息。
translation: That elderly man, however, never stops praying for a man and woman.

source_sentence: 後於異時，有一薩埵餘處命終，遂便託娠於長者妻腹。
translation: At some point later, a sattva who had lived to the end of his life then placed a pregnancy in the womb of an elderly man's wife.

source_sentence: 有智女人善知五事。
translation: There are five things that a wise woman well knows.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一、知男子有染心無染心；二、知時知節；三、知得娠；四、知從彼男得娠；五、知是男女，若是男時胎在右邊，女在左邊。
translation: 1. knows that a man has a defiled or undefiled mind; 2. knows the time and place; 3. knows he's pregnant; 4. knows he's pregnant from that man; 5. knows it's a man or woman, and if it's a man, the fetus is on the right side and the woman is on the left side.

source_sentence: 其長者妻既得娠已，生大歡喜，報其夫曰：「賢首！
translation: After she became pregnant, the elder's wife became very happy and reported to her husband, "Good man!

source_sentence: 仁今知不？
translation: Do you know now?

source_sentence: 我已有子，今在右邊，必知是男。」
translation: I already have a son, and now he's on the right side; I'm sure he's a boy."

source_sentence: 長者聞已，甚大歡喜，便舉右手，仰面而笑，作如是語：「我於多時，祈請天神，求覓男女，助我家事，代我劬勞。
translation: When the elder heard this, he rejoiced greatly, raised his right hand, looked up, smiled, and said, "For a long time, I've prayed to the gods to find a man and a woman to help me with my family's business and take care of my burdens.

source_sentence: 我所不及，當為我作，子孫昌延，得長久住。
translation: They will do for me what I don't have, so that my children and grandchildren will prosper and have a long life.

source_sentence: 我若死後，為我追福稱我名字，當願我父生於善處。」
translation: If I were to memorialize my merits and call them by my name after I die, I would want my father to be born in a good place."

source_sentence: 既知有子，即令安置在高樓上，任情遊戲，寒時進火，熱時招涼，飲食知時，宜食給與。
translation: Once they know they have a son, they'll place him on a high building where he can play with his emotions, put in fire when it's cold, invite coolness when it's hot, and eat and drink knowing the appropriate time to give him food.

source_sentence: 六時相順者依時而進，悉皆如法。
translation: Those who follow the six seasons advance according to the seasons, all according to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 嚴身瓔珞，一如天女遊歡喜園，從床至床，從蹬至蹬，足不履地，又亦不令聞惡音聲。
translation: They adorn their bodies with diadem, just like a goddess visiting the Garden of Joy, going from bed to bed and from stirrup to stirrup without their feet touching the ground, and they don't allow bad sounds to be heard.

source_sentence: 十月滿足，至欲生時，在於聞星下生。
translation: When she reaches the time of birth after fulfilling the ten-month period, she'll be born under the star of hearing.

source_sentence: 其子端正，令人樂見，耳上便有寶璫，珠自然而出。
translation: His son is so correct that people are delighted to see him, and then he gets a jeweled ear in disgrace and a pearl that comes out naturally.

source_sentence: 其父告左右曰：「汝可喚別寶之人。」
translation: His father tells his attendants, "You may summon someone who has another jewel."

source_sentence: 既喚來已，告言：「此寶價直幾許？」
translation: Once he summons him, he tells him, "How much does this treasure cost?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「無能作價；常法無價之寶，皆作一俱胝金錢而准。」
translation: He answered, "Nothing can be valued; the priceless treasures of the eternal Dharma are all measured as a single koṭī of money."

source_sentence: 是時其子生來，已經三七日，集諸眷屬，建立名號。
translation: It was then that his son was born, and it had been three or seven days since he gathered his retinue and established a name.

source_sentence: 爾時親屬共相議曰：「欲立何名？」
translation: The retinue then conferred with each other, saying, "What name do you want to establish?"

source_sentence: 諸親共言：「此是聞星中生，復有寶耳璫珠莊嚴其耳，此寶價直俱胝。
translation: The relatives all said, "This is the star from which we heard, and there are precious earrings and beads adorning its ears, and this treasure is worth a hundred crowns.

source_sentence: 為斯事故。
translation: This is the reason for it.

source_sentence: 孩子可名曰聞俱胝耳。」
translation: The child can be called 'Hearing the ear of the corpuscles.'"

source_sentence: 當生之日，長者家內，婢生二子，一名曰奴，二名擁護。
translation: On the day he was born, a maid gave birth to two sons in the elder's household, one named Nou and the other named Caohu.

source_sentence: 長者即令乳養，置八乳母看之：二常懷抱、二常乳食、二人洗浴、二常共遊戲作樂。
translation: The elder then ordered them to be nursed and placed eight nursemaids in their care: two to always carry them, two to always nurse and feed them, two to always bathe them, and two to always play and enjoy themselves together.

source_sentence: 此八嬭母日夜供侍，常以乳酪酥及醍醐勝妙甘美飲食供給，如蓮在水，速能長大。
translation: These eight nursemaids serve him day and night, always offering him cheese, butter, and ghee, wonderful, sweet food, and drink, just like a lotus in water, which quickly grows up.

source_sentence: 既長成已，即教學藝，先學文字算數，及知物價，別衣別木，別寶別象，別男別女，如是八種，悉皆明了。
translation: Once they've grown up, they then teach art, first learning how to write and count, knowing prices, distinguishing clothing from wood, treasures from elephants, and men from women, and so on, all eight of which they fully understand.

source_sentence: 其父便為造三種堂室，謂冬、夏、秋。
translation: His father then made three kinds of halls, which are called winter, summer, and autumn.

source_sentence: 復作三種園苑，三種宮殿，上、中、下別。
translation: He also made three kinds of parks and three kinds of palaces, distinguishing between upper, middle, and lower.

source_sentence: 聞俱胝耳共諸婇女，往詣閣上遊戲。
translation: They hear about it, and they go up to the tower with their girls to play.

source_sentence: 力軍長者，所有家事農業耕墾，皆悉自作。
translation: That powerful man did all the family's farming and cultivation himself.

source_sentence: 其子見父自為農業墾耕之作，告其父曰：「云何躬自執作？」
translation: When his son saw that his father was cultivating the land himself, he asked his father, "Why do you carry out the work yourself?"

source_sentence: 長者告曰：「我往亦如汝在閣上遊戲快樂，其樂不久便盡。」
translation: The elder told him, "I used to play happily in the same way you did in the tower, but my enjoyment won't end anytime soon."

source_sentence: 子白父言：「若如是者，當賜處分，我應入海採寶。」
translation: The son said to his father, "If that's the case, you'll be given a share of the punishment, and I should go into the ocean to gather treasure."

source_sentence: 父曰：「如人所食麻米五穀，汝所食寶我亦能辦。
translation: The father said, "As people eat rice and hemp and grains, so I can handle the treasure you eat.

source_sentence: 我之財物，終不少乏，汝何用入海？」
translation: There's never a shortage of my goods, so why would you need to go into the sea?"

source_sentence: 子便三請，復白父言：「願賜處分，放我入海。」
translation: The son then asked him three times and again said to his father, "May I be granted permission to enter the ocean."

source_sentence: 其父不隨所請，子復白言：「許我入海。」
translation: His father didn't comply with his request, but the son again said, "Allow me to enter the ocean."

source_sentence: 父知子意決定不移，即放令去。
translation: Knowing that the son's mind was set on nothing, the father let him go.

source_sentence: 是時長者於聚落中，搖鈴宣告：「在此居住之人願聞，我子今欲入海採寶。
translation: The elder then rang a bell in the village and announced, "People who live here want to hear that my son now wants to go into the ocean to gather treasure.

source_sentence: 若有人去者，在路無課，亦不輸脚，及無差科，當自辦財物。」
translation: If anyone goes, there's no tax on the road, no foot loss, and no difference in pay, so they'll prepare their own goods."

source_sentence: 時有五百商人，各辦米糧。
translation: There were then five hundred merchants, each preparing rice and provisions.

source_sentence: 于時婆羅仙長者，請五百商人，家中設食已，告諸商人曰：「如我愛子，亦如汝子。
translation: Then, the elder Vārāṇasī invited the five hundred merchants to his home and set out food there, telling the merchants, "Just as I love my son, so are your sons.

source_sentence: 若作不善無利益事，當須勸諫，勿令作惡。」
translation: If you do anything unwholesome or unbeneficial, you must encourage and not allow them to do evil."

source_sentence: 時諸商人，並皆敬諾，又告子曰：「汝聞我語，皆應奉行，若商人有教，亦如我言。
translation: The merchants all then honored him and told his son, "All of you who hear my words should approve of them, and if a merchant has a teaching, it's just as I said.

source_sentence: 莫在前行，亦莫在後。
translation: Don't go before, and don't go after.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 或有強賊、或有力弱。
translation: Sometimes there are strong thieves, and sometimes there are strong and weak ones.

source_sentence: 其勇健者，在商人前來；然力弱者，從後而來。
translation: The brave ones come before the merchants, but the weak ones come from behind.

source_sentence: 若商主被損，商眾總損。」
translation: If the merchant's master is harmed, the merchants are all harmed."

source_sentence: 子聞其父說此語已，父又喚彼家生二奴：「汝等當聽！
translation: After the son heard his father say this, he called to the two slaves born in his household, "Listen, you!

source_sentence: 汝之二人，不得一人輒離我子。」
translation: Neither of you should easily leave my son."

source_sentence: 二奴啟曰：「誠如聖言！
translation: The two slaves replied, "It's just as the sage said!

source_sentence: 誠如聖言！」
translation: True to the holy words!"

source_sentence: 其長者復作思惟：「欲令我子乘騎何乘？
translation: The elder then again considered, "What vehicle do I want my son to ride?

source_sentence: 若與象馬，乘騎費糧。
translation: If we were to take an elephant or horse, it would cost us provisions to ride it.

source_sentence: 當與乘驢，而為輕省。」
translation: You should give them the donkey ride and save yourself a lot of trouble."

source_sentence: 作是念已，即辦驢乘發遣，道路所須，具皆悉備。
translation: After he thought this, he prepared a donkey ride and sent it off, complete with everything needed for the road.

source_sentence: 其長者子往詣母所，白言：「阿母！
translation: The elder son went to his mother's house and said, "Mother!

source_sentence: 我今入海採寶。」
translation: Now, I'll go into the ocean to gather treasure."

source_sentence: 時母聞已，迷悶悲啼，勸不令去，告曰：「何時更得見汝？」
translation: When his mother heard this, she was perplexed and lamented, discouraged from leaving, and told him, "When will I see you again?"

source_sentence: 子生瞋故答曰：「於惡趣中相見。」
translation: Because he's angry, the son replies, "We'll see each other in a bad destiny."

source_sentence: 母報子言：「汝所出語，極為麁穢不善，宜應悔過令罪減少。」
translation: The mother told the son, "What you have said is extremely crude and unskillful; it's appropriate to repent and have your sins reduced."

source_sentence: 即於母前，而便悔過。
translation: He then repented of his transgressions before his mother.

source_sentence: 既悔過已，乘騎進發。
translation: After repenting, he mounted his horse and set out.

source_sentence: 時諸婆羅門等，為作吉祥呪願已，即以運戴貨物，應所須者，皆悉持去。
translation: After making the vow for an auspicious spell, the brāhmaṇas and others carried whatever goods they needed and took them away.

source_sentence: 漸漸遊行，經無量聚落城邑，方至大海。
translation: They gradually marched past measureless villages and cities before reaching the ocean.

source_sentence: 即共五百商人，持五百金錢，用雇船舶及五船師：一人執柁、一人知進、一人知退、一人修補船、一人別水。
translation: They then joined together five hundred merchants, took five hundred coins, hired a boat and five boatmasters: one to hold the beam, one to know when to advance, one to know when to retire, one to repair the boat, and one to make up the water.

source_sentence: 既裝束已，再三祈願。
translation: After they were fitted out, they repeatedly prayed for them.

source_sentence: 于時商主長者子，擊鼓宣令，論說海中善不善事。
translation: The merchant master, the elder son, then beat his drum and announced the order, speaking about the good and bad things that go on in the ocean.

source_sentence: 舶發去已，便至寶所多取寶物，安穩而迴，還到海岸。
translation: After the ship departed, he went to the treasure house, took more treasures, returned safely, and reached the shore.

source_sentence: 爾時商主長者子，別於一方，於沙灘上居止，共二家生計算來去用度之物。
translation: The merchant's son, the eldest, was staying on a separate side of the beach, and together with two other family members, they calculated what they would need for their return.

source_sentence: 其長者子告自奴曰：「馱索迦！
translation: The elder son told his slave, "Dāsaka!

source_sentence: 汝往看諸商人，今作何事？」
translation: What are you doing now, having seen the merchants?"

source_sentence: 奴往急看，乃見商人並皆眠臥，奴便睡眠。
translation: When he rushed to look, he saw the merchants all sleeping, and he went to sleep.

source_sentence: 其長者子，後命令擁護往看商人，今作何事？
translation: He then ordered his eldest son to escort him to the merchant to see what he was doing.

source_sentence: 時波洛迦見諸商人皆悉被辦，馱乘欲發。
translation: When Pārāḍa saw that all the merchants had been taken care of, Dāsaka wanted to give them a boost.

source_sentence: 其馱索迦謂言：「波洛迦報。」
translation: Dāsaka said, "It's Pārājika's reward."

source_sentence: 波洛迦復謂：「馱索迦報彼商主。」
translation: Again, Pārāḍa said, "Dāsaka repays the merchant."

source_sentence: 是時二奴隨商人去。
translation: Those two slaves then followed the merchants away.

source_sentence: 至天明已，二奴既不見長者子東西驅走，問諸商人曰：「長者子今何所在？」
translation: When daybreak came, they didn't see the elder son and drove him away, so they asked the merchants, "Where is the elder son now?"

source_sentence: 或有答言：「在前。」
translation: Some people reply, "In front."

source_sentence: 或言：「在後。」
translation: Or they say, "At the back."

source_sentence: 皆覓不見。
translation: They all looked for him and didn't see him.

source_sentence: 諸商人等各相告言：「我等棄捨商主，甚為非理，急須往覓。」
translation: The merchants each told one another, "It's very unreasonable for us to abandon our merchant, so we urgently need to search for him."

source_sentence: 時諸商人，或有言：「此路極險，若覓商主，我等皆死；然而商主覓不可得。
translation: Some of those merchants then said, "This road is extremely dangerous, and if we look for the merchant owner, we'll all die; yet the merchant owner is unavailable.

source_sentence: 我等共為方便，若至家時父問商主，在前行者云：『商主在後。』
translation: We'll work together to make it easier for them. When they arrive home, their father asks about the merchant owner, and those who are traveling ahead say, 'The merchant owner is behind us.'

source_sentence: 若問在後，云：『商主在前。』
translation: If he asks about the merchant owner in the back, he says, 'The merchant owner is in the front.'

source_sentence: 然不得云：『失却商主。』」
translation: But you mustn't say, 'I've lost the merchant.'"

source_sentence: 作是語已，漸至本村。
translation: After saying this, he gradually reached his village.

source_sentence: 其婆羅仙長者，聞諸商人來至，歡喜前行，問諸人曰：「我子何在？」
translation: When that elder Brahmā heard that the merchants had arrived, he rejoiced and went ahead, asking them, "Where's my son?"

source_sentence: 其前行者答曰：「在後。」
translation: The person traveling ahead of him replied, "Behind him!"

source_sentence: 其在後人，告言：「向前。」
translation: Those who are behind them say, "Forward!"

source_sentence: 其婆羅仙便作是念：「此等諸人誑惑於我，我子應死為復失耶？」
translation: The Vārāṇasī then thought, "These people have deceived me, so why should my son die and lose it again?"

source_sentence: 爾時長者無希望心，生大苦惱，親屬聚集，俱時啼泣。
translation: At the time, the elder's hopeless mind became greatly distressed, and his family gathered together, weeping.

source_sentence: 眾人皆往長者家，舉聲大哭。
translation: They all went to the elder's house and raised their voices, weeping loudly.

source_sentence: 為哭多故，其長者及婦，二俱眼盲，四遠諸人皆知長者子於大海中失沒。
translation: As a result of much weeping, the elder and his wife were both blind, and people from four distances away knew that the elder's son had been lost in the ocean.

source_sentence: 其婆羅仙長者久持孝服，子在之日，所有鞋履衣服文書受用之具，皆悉施與村中祕祠，即發誓言：「若我子命存，所在之處，安穩速達。
translation: The elder Brahmā had long worn filial robes, and when his son was alive, he gave all of his shoes, shoes, clothing, and instruments for use to the village shrine, vowing, "If my son lives, where he is, he'll be stable and quickly reach it.

source_sentence: 若身已死，願生勝處。」
translation: If he dies, he hopes to be born in a superior place."

source_sentence: 其長者子睡，時被日照身，覺已為風吹沙乃不見路，不知商人從何處去？
translation: When the elder's son was asleep, the sun shone on him, and he realized that the wind had blown the sand away and he hadn't seen the road, so he didn't know where the merchant was going.

source_sentence: 即乘驢而行。
translation: He then rode a donkey and traveled on it.

source_sentence: 驢省非是舊路，徐徐而行。
translation: He realized that the donkey wasn't on the old road, so he slowly moved along.

source_sentence: 其長者子為驢行緩，以杖打之，驢被打困更不能行。
translation: The elder's son, being slow on the donkey's feet, beat him with a stick, and the donkey was beaten and trapped, unable to walk again.

source_sentence: 長者子復作思惟：「誰忍見此困苦之事，無慈愍心更打此驢？」
translation: The elder son then repeatedly thought, "Who could bear to see this painful situation and beat the ass again without compassion?"

source_sentence: 即自步行，驅驢而去。
translation: He then took off on foot and drove his donkey away.

source_sentence: 見一鐵城，其城廣大，牆壁極高，其中寬大。
translation: He saw a city of iron that was vast, with walls that were extremely high and a wide interior.

source_sentence: 至城門所，見一丈夫，其身長大，黑色赤精，遍身有毛，其腹麁大，甚可怖畏，執杖而住。
translation: When he arrived at the city gate, he saw a man with a long, black, red, and hairy body and a large, fearsome belly, who was holding a staff and standing there.

source_sentence: 時長者子問其人曰：「丈夫！
translation: The son of the elder then asked that man, "Husband!

source_sentence: 此中有水不？」
translation: Is there water in this?"

source_sentence: 彼默不言。
translation: He remained silent.

source_sentence: 長者子問已，即入城中。
translation: After he asked, the elder son went into the city.

source_sentence: 為渴所逼，迷悶東西，求覓水故，竟無可得，不稱所求，遂即大聲云：「水！
translation: Being overcome by thirst, he was confused and looked for water, but he couldn't get any.
Water!"

source_sentence: 時有五百餓鬼，一時而來，如燒木柱，自髮覆體，咽如針孔，腹如大山，節節火出，赫然俱熾，告商主曰：「汝大慈悲，與我水飲，我等渴逼。」
translation: Five hundred hungry ghosts came at once, like burning wooden pillars, with their hair covering their bodies, their throats like pinholes, and their bellies like huge mountains, and they were all ablaze with fire, and they told the merchant, "Have great compassion, give me water to drink because our thirst is urgent."

source_sentence: 長者子曰：「我為渴逼求水，故入此城中。」
translation: The elder son said, "I was thirsty and desperate for water, so I went into this city."

source_sentence: 餓鬼報言：「此是餓鬼之城，何處得水？
translation: The hungry ghosts replied, "This is a city of hungry ghosts, where can I get water?

source_sentence: 十二年中，我等不聞水名。」
translation: For twelve years, we didn't hear the name of the water."

source_sentence: 長者子問曰：「造何罪業，生在此中？」
translation: The elder son asked, "What sinful activity did you commit to be born here?"

source_sentence: 餓鬼答曰：「贍部洲人，多生難信，我今若說，汝亦不信。」
translation: The hungry ghost replied, "Many people on Jambudvīpa have trouble believing, so if I were to tell you now, you wouldn't believe me either."

source_sentence: 長者子告曰：「我今對驗，面前而見，云何不信？」
translation: The Gṛdhrakūṭa told him, "Now that I've examined it and seen it before me, why don't you believe it?"

source_sentence: 是時餓鬼而說頌言：「我曾罵詈常瞋恚，　　慳悋惜財不與人；　亦不曾行於布施，　　緣此業故生餓鬼。」
translation: The hungry ghost then spoke this verse, saying, "I used to ridicule and always hate, and I'm stingy with my money and don't give it to others. I've never practiced generosity, and it's because of this action that I'm born a hungry ghost."

source_sentence: 時長者子，生厭離煩惱之心，即急出城，告彼丈夫曰：「汝當報我，此是餓鬼城耶？
translation: The elder son then became disillusioned with the afflictions and rushed out of the city and told the man, "Will you repay me, is this the city of hungry ghosts?

source_sentence: 我當不入。」
translation: I will not enter."

source_sentence: 丈夫答曰：「商主！
translation: The man replied, "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 汝可見聞入餓鬼城，更有得出者不？
translation: Do you see anyone who has heard of entering the city of hungry ghosts and has yet to escape?

source_sentence: 為汝有大福威德，今得重出。
translation: Because of your great merit and virtue, you've now been reborn.

source_sentence: 好去！
translation: Good riddance!

source_sentence: 好去！」
translation: Good to go!"

source_sentence: 時長者子漸漸前行，日欲暮時，乃見化天宮處。
translation: It was then that the elder son traveled gradually, and as the sun was about to set, he saw the place where the celestial palace was transformed.

source_sentence: 有一天子，復有四天女，共為歡樂遊戲天宮。
translation: There was a godson and four goddesses who were playing happily together in the palace of that god.

source_sentence: 其天遙見長者子，告曰：「商主無病。
translation: Those gods saw the elder son from a distance and told him, "The merchant is not ill.

source_sentence: 汝有飢渴不？」
translation: Do you have hunger and thirst?"

source_sentence: 答言：「甚飢渴耳！」
translation: He replied, "I'm hungry and thirsty!"

source_sentence: 于時天子即令商主洗浴，供妙飲食，其夜止宿。
translation: The god then caused the merchant to bathe himself, served him a wonderful meal, and stayed the night.

source_sentence: 至天曉已，於日出時，其宮變化，前四天女變為黧狗，捉此天子，覆面撲著於熱鐵床上，猛焰星流，食其背肉。
translation: When sunrise arrived, his palace was transformed at sunrise, and the first four goddesses were transformed into sallow dogs, which caught the prince, covered his face, threw him down on a hot iron bed, and a fierce flame ran down his back.

source_sentence: 復至暮間日欲沒時，還復變為天宮，狗乃變為天女。
translation: When the sun was about to go down at sunset, he was again transformed into a celestial palace, and the dogs were transformed into celestial maidens.

source_sentence: 然長者子眼親見已，情切怪異，即告彼天子曰：「汝作何業今生此處？」
translation: However, after he saw it with his own eyes, the son of the elder was so impressed and surprised that he told the celestial, "What did you do to deserve to be born here?"

source_sentence: 時天子答曰：「商主！
translation: The then emperor replied, "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 南贍部洲人多難信。」
translation: Many people on Jambudvīpa have trouble believing that."

source_sentence: 長者子曰：「我今目驗，云何不信？」
translation: The elder son said, "Now that I've examined it with my own eyes, why don't you believe it?"

source_sentence: 爾時天子說往昔業緣，以頌答曰：「昔時白日損他命，　　夜則持戒勤修行；　以此因緣生此中，　　今受如是善惡業。」
translation: It was then that the prince spoke of the causes and conditions of past actions and replied with a verse, "In the past, the sunlight harmed the lives of others, and at night he observed precepts and cultivated them. Because of these causes and conditions, I was born here, and now I'm subject to such good and bad actions."

source_sentence: 時長者子聞此頌已白言：「頌有何義？」
translation: After hearing this verse, the elder son said, "What's the meaning of this verse?"

source_sentence: 天子答曰：「商主！
translation: The emperor replied, "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 我往昔時在婆索村中，身為屠兒，常以殺羊賣肉自養育身。
translation: Once upon a time, I was a butcher's son in a village in Vātsī, and I used to kill sheep and sell their meat to support myself.

source_sentence: 時有聖者苾芻，名迦多演那，勸我改悔，勿造斯業，無有盡期。
translation: Then, a noble monk named Kātyāyanīputra advised me to repent and not to do such deeds, which would never end.

source_sentence: 既勸不得，是時聖者又復勸我，令夜持戒。
translation: Having failed to persuade him, the noble man then also persuaded me to observe the precepts at night.

source_sentence: 我即依教。
translation: I then complied with his teaching.

source_sentence: 以此業故，今者白日受苦；為夜持戒，夜受如是快樂果報。
translation: As a result of that action, I now suffer during the daytime and observe the precepts at night, and I experience this happy result at night.

source_sentence: 商主！
translation: "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 若至彼村見我男女，為我告言：『我見汝父極受苦報，汝今改悔休作此業。』」
translation: If you go to that village and see my son or daughter, tell them for me, 'I've seen your father suffer terribly; now repent and stop doing this activity.'"

source_sentence: 時長者子告曰：「汝今自說南贍部人難化難信。」
translation: The son of the elder then told him, "Now, you yourself say that the people of Jambū are difficult to teach and difficult to believe."

source_sentence: 天子報曰：「為將一信，報我子言：『其殺羊處地下有一瓶金，爾可穿取隨意受用，自然快樂。
translation: The gods rewarded him, "In order to convert one, he told my son, 'There's a vial of gold under the ground where he killed that sheep.

source_sentence: 亦應時時供養聖者迦多演那，是人天福田。
translation: You should also make offerings to the noble Kātyāyanā from time to time, for that would be a field of merit for humans and gods.

source_sentence: 所供養者，布施之時，稱讚我名願罪消滅。』」
translation: When you make offerings, praise my name and vow to extinguish your sins.'"

source_sentence: 是時商主聞此語已，漸進前行，復見天宮。
translation: After hearing these words, the merchant gradually moved forward and saw the celestial palace again.

source_sentence: 有一天子，共諸天女歡喜遊戲，遙見長者子告言：「商主！
translation: There was a celestial son who was playing joyfully with the goddesses, and he saw the elder son from a distance and told him, "Master Shōtoku!

source_sentence: 願爾無病，不有飢渴耶？」
translation: May you be without illness and without hunger or thirst?"

source_sentence: 長者子曰：「我有飢渴。」
translation: The son of the elder said, "I have hunger and thirst."

source_sentence: 天子即令洗浴，設諸飲食，止息安臥。
translation: The gods then ordered him to wash himself, prepare food and drink, and stop to rest and lie down.

source_sentence: 至日暮時，天宮復變，天女為大蛇，繞天子身，周匝食腦。
translation: When sunset arrived, the celestial palace was transformed again, and the goddess became a huge snake that circled the son's body and ate his brains out.

source_sentence: 至日出時，還復天宮，作天子形及以天女。
translation: When the sun rises, he returns to the celestial palace and takes the form of the son of god and the goddesses.

source_sentence: 其商主怪異，問彼天子曰：「曾造何業生於此中？」
translation: The merchant owner wondered, "Did the gods ever create any activity to be born here?"

source_sentence: 天子報曰：「南贍部洲人，難化難信，我不能說。」
translation: The prince of gods answered, "The people of Jambudvīpa are so difficult to teach and so difficult to believe that I can't explain them."

source_sentence: 時長者子答曰：「我目親見，云何無信？」
translation: The elder son then replied, "I've seen them with my own eyes, so why don't I have faith?"

source_sentence: 爾時天子說伽他曰：「夜共他婦宿，　　晝日護尸羅；　緣此業果故，　　受斯善惡報。」
translation: It was then that the prince spoke to Gṛdhrakūṭa, "He sleeps with other women at night and protects Śīla by day; as a result of this action, he receives the results of good and bad actions."

source_sentence: 時長者子問曰：「此說何義？」
translation: The son of Gṛdhrakūṭa then asked, "What does this mean?"

source_sentence: 天子答曰：「我曾往昔在婆索婆村中，常行婬欲，婬他女婦。
translation: The gods replied, "Once upon a time, I was in the village of Vātsīpa and used to engage in sexual misconduct and lust after other women.

source_sentence: 後逢聖者迦多演那，勸我悔造非法惡業。
translation: Then I met the sage Kātyāyanīputra, who urged me to repent of creating unlawful and bad karma.

source_sentence: 我由不斷斯事，聖者復言：『汝不常斷者，白日持戒、夜還行非。』
translation: Because I didn't stop doing that, the sage again said, 'If you don't always stop, you'll observe precepts by day and return to wrongdoing by night.'

source_sentence: 緣此事故白日受天快樂，夜受苦報。
translation: As a result, I'll experience the pleasures of gods by day and the rewards of suffering by night.

source_sentence: 善哉長者子！
translation: Good, Gṛhapati!

source_sentence: 去至彼村，我有一子，幸為報之。
translation: When I go to that village, I have a son whom I'm glad to repay.

source_sentence: 我見汝父作如是言：『我由前生曾作此業，婬他女婦受地獄苦。』」
translation: I saw your father say this, 'In a previous life, I did this deed of lusting after another woman and was subjected to the pain of hell.'"

source_sentence: 時長者子言：「南贍部洲人難化難信，云何肯受？」
translation: The elder's son then said, "How can the people of Jambudvīpa, who are difficult to teach and difficult to believe, accept this?"

source_sentence: 天子報曰：「若不信時，告言：『我生存日，祭火爐地下有二瓶金，當可穿取，自受快樂。
translation: The gods replied, "If you don't believe them, tell them, 'On the day I live, there will be two vials of gold underneath the fire altar that you can put on and take away and be happy with.

source_sentence: 又復時時供養人天所奉大迦多演那，發弘誓願，稱我名號，願罪消除，得生善趣。』」
translation: Also, he would make offerings from time to time to the great Kātyāyanīya that's worshipped by humans and gods, making a great vow to call on my name, hoping to be rid of sins and be born in a good destiny.'"

source_sentence: 時長者子領受此語，次復前行，去此未遠，乃更遙見園苑。
translation: Accepting these words, the elder student went on his way, and before he got farther away, he saw a garden.

source_sentence: 其中有師子座，座上有一婦女而坐，顏容妙好，人所喜見。
translation: There was a lion's seat, and on that seat was a woman sitting with a beautiful face that people liked to see.

source_sentence: 座四脚下各有一餓鬼，縛著座脚而住。
translation: Under each of the seat's four legs was a hungry ghost tied to the seat's feet and standing there.

source_sentence: 時此婦人遙見長者子來，告言：「商主！
translation: When this woman saw the elder son coming from a distance, she told him, "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 無病少惱。
translation: He's free of illness and has few afflictions.

source_sentence: 有飢渴耶？」
translation: Is there hunger and thirst?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「我甚飢渴！」
translation: He replied, "I'm hungry and thirsty!"

source_sentence: 時彼婦人告長者子曰：「與汝諸漿。
translation: That woman then told the elder's son, "Here's some milk for you.

source_sentence: 汝可作盟：今所與漿，勿得與此四箇飢鬼。」
translation: You can make a promise: Don't give this four hungry ghosts any of the milk you're giving now."

source_sentence: 長者子答曰：「敬諾所言。」
translation: The elder son answered, "I'll honor your word."

source_sentence: 既蒙設漿及妙飲食，時彼婦人欲現餓鬼業報之事故，便入一房，隱身藏住。
translation: After receiving the offered milk and a wonderful meal, that woman wanted to show the results of her actions as a hungry ghost, so she went into a room, hid herself, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 諸餓鬼等即白長者子曰：「汝大慈悲，願賜少許飲食。」
translation: The hungry ghosts then said to the elder son, "You're very compassionate; please give her a little food and drink."

source_sentence: 其長者子心生憐愍，即擲食與。
translation: The elder son felt compassion for them and tossed them food.

source_sentence: 第一得食，變為炎熱鐵團；第二得食，變為麥糠；第三得食，變為膿血不淨；第四得食，乃還食噉自身肉血。
translation: The first thing he got to eat turned into a hot iron ball; the second thing he got to eat turned into wheat chaff; the third thing he got to eat turned into pus and blood that was impure; and the fourth thing he got to eat turned back into food that gnawed on his own flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 爾時餓鬼吞熱鐵丸者，燒身臭穢，婦人聞氣，即出高聲告長者子曰：「汝所作者甚為非理，不應與彼飲食。」
translation: When the hungry ghost swallows the hot iron ball, it burns its body and smells foul, and when the woman hears its breath, she raises her voice and tells the son of the elder, "What you've done is so unreasonable that you shouldn't give it to him for food and drink."

source_sentence: 其長者子答曰：「妹子！
translation: The elder's son replied, "Sister!

source_sentence: 彼見求我，心生慈悲，云何不與？」
translation: When they see that they're seeking me, their mind becomes compassionate, so why don't they give it to them?"

source_sentence: 時婦人言：「我心慈悲，更大於汝。
translation: The woman then said, "My heart is kind and compassionate, and it's greater than yours.

source_sentence: 然此餓鬼：一者是我夫婿，二者是我之子，三者是我新婦，四者是我家奴。」
translation: Still, this hungry ghost is: one, my husband's son-in-law; two, my son; three, my bride; and four, my household slave."

source_sentence: 是時長者子問曰：「曾造何罪，生在此中？」
translation: The elder's son then asked, "What sin did he commit to be born here?"

source_sentence: 婦人告曰：「南贍部洲人難化難信，說有何益？」
translation: The woman told him, "The people of Jambudvīpa are difficult to teach and difficult to believe, so what good is it to tell them?"

source_sentence: 長者子曰：「我今現見，云何不信？」
translation: The elder son said, "Now that I've seen it, why don't I believe it?"

source_sentence: 時婦人言：「我於往昔，於婆索婆村，曾為梵志女，因歲星節日家中設食，乃有聖者人天所奉迦多演那，來乞飯食。
translation: The woman then said, "Once upon a time, when I was a priestess in the village of Vātsīpa, I was given food at home on the occasion of the annual star festival, and a holy man or god consecrated as Kātyāyanā came to beg for food.

source_sentence: 我生歡喜，施滿鉢盂食。
translation: I rejoiced and gave him a bowl full of food.

source_sentence: 我復生念：『今可告夫，冀生隨喜施食之因。』
translation: Then I thought, 'Now, I can tell my husband that I want to give him food as a cause for rejoicing.'

source_sentence: 其夫瞋恚婦曰：『尚未供養諸婆羅門，因何先施禿頭之人。
translation: Her husband was angry with the woman, saying, 'Why would you give to a bald person before you've made offerings to the brāhmaṇas?

source_sentence: 云何不與熱鐵丸？』
translation: Why don't you give him a hot iron ball?'

source_sentence: 既不遂情。
translation: Since he didn't get his way, the next time he encouraged his son, he replied, 'Why don't you eat the chaff?'

source_sentence: 次當勸子，子復報云：『何不食其麥糠？』
translation: The next time he encouraged his son, he again replied, 'Why don't you eat his wheat chaff?'

source_sentence: 後時我遣一奴送食與諸親眷，奴得食已，在路自飡上妙好者。
translation: I then sent a slave to deliver food to my relatives, and when he got the food, he ate something excellent on the road itself.

source_sentence: 迴至勘問，其奴便諱：『我若在路食之，願我當食自身膿血。』
translation: When I returned to ask about it, the slave then said, 'If I had eaten it on the road, may I eat my own pus and blood.'

source_sentence: 後時諸親又送食來，新婦盜食。
translation: Later, some relatives brought her food, but the bride stole it.

source_sentence: 我又問之，答言：『不食！
translation: When I asked her again, she replied, 'No!'

source_sentence: 若食，願我自食身肉。』」
translation: If I eat it, may I eat my own flesh.'"

source_sentence: 白言：「商主！
translation: He said, "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 其夫婿、兒子、新婦，及奴者，此餓鬼等是，並由自作，今受餓鬼。
translation: These hungry ghosts are their husbands, sons, brides, and slaves, and so forth, and they themselves have created them and are now subject to being hungry ghosts.

source_sentence: 由我布施聖者迦多演那一飡之食，作如是言：『汝若受報，我當眼見。』
translation: Because I gave the sage Kātyāyanīputra a mouthful of food, I said, 'If you receive the reward, I will see it with my own eyes.'

source_sentence: 我先布施天人所供迦多演那，應生帝釋天宮；由發惡願故，今墮餓鬼道中。
translation: After I gave alms to Kātyāyanīputra, he would have been born in the palace of Indra; now, because of that bad vow, he's fallen into the destiny of a hungry ghost.

source_sentence: 商主！
translation: Master merchant!

source_sentence: 仁若往訪婆索婆村，我有一女，在彼村中為婬女，幸可為報云：『汝父母兄嫂及奴，墮在餓鬼趣中受苦，由先作惡今受此苦，汝今應可悔過，莫作斯惡，當受苦報。』」
translation: If you visit the village of Vātsīpa, I have a daughter who's a promiscuous woman in that village, and it's fortunate that you can be rewarded, saying, 'Your parents, brothers, sisters, wives, and slaves have fallen into the destinies of hungry ghosts and are suffering because of the evil you did in the past and are now suffering, so now you should repent and not do such evil, and you will be rewarded with suffering.'"

source_sentence: 長者子曰：「南贍部洲人多難信，不受我語。」
translation: The elder son said, "Many people on Jambudvīpa find it hard to believe and won't accept my words."

source_sentence: 白言：「商主！
translation: He said, "Master merchant!

source_sentence: 彼若不信者，便當告：『我先臥床下，有四瓶金并一金杖及金澡罐，汝當出取金瓶任意受用。
translation: If he doesn't believe it, then he'll tell them, 'Under my bed there were four vials of gold, a gold staff, and a gold bath jar.

source_sentence: 復須時時供養天人所識迦多演那美妙飲食，并稱我名令我得福罪當輕薄。』」
translation: You must also make offerings from time to time to Kātyāyanīputra, a beautiful food known to gods and humans, and call me by my name so that my merits will be lessened.'"

source_sentence: 時長者子既聞語已，即便辭別，入房眠睡。
translation: After hearing those words, the elder son said goodbye and went to sleep in his room.

source_sentence: 爾時諸鬼互相告曰：「汝等應知，此長者子正睡，可持送往婆索婆村，置靈床上。」
translation: The demons then told each other, "You should know that this elder son is sleeping, so you can take him to Vātsīpa village and put him on a spirit bed."

source_sentence: 時諸鬼等，依言將往。
translation: The demons then complied, and they were about to go.

source_sentence: 是時商主至明清旦日欲出時，即便睡覺，乃見諸床及以小床、靴履之物，一切資具之上皆有其名字。
translation: When the merchant was about to leave at sunrise, he went to sleep and saw the beds, the cots, the shoes and footwear, and all the necessities with their names on them.

source_sentence: 次第讀看有如是語：「我今所施此物，願子早來。
translation: Reading them one by one, he saw these words, "Now, I've given this to my son, so I hope he comes early.

source_sentence: 如若死者，隨所生處願此諸物，並皆隨從。」
translation: If someone dies, take these things with you wherever you were born, and I wish for them to be followed."

source_sentence: 見斯事已，即思惟言：「我之父母，既知我死，何須更住？
translation: After seeing this, they then thought, "My parents know I'm dead, so why do they need to stay any longer?

source_sentence: 宜可往詣聖者迦多演那所，而為出家，修其梵行。」
translation: It's a good idea to go to the sage Kātyāyana, leave home, and cultivate the religious practice."

source_sentence: 作是念已，即便往詣迦多演那所。
translation: After he thought this, he went to Kātyāyanīya.

source_sentence: 時具壽迦多演那，遙見長者子來，見已即告語言：「善來商主！
translation: Kātyāyanīputra then saw the elder son coming from afar, and when he saw him, he told him, "Well done, merchant!

source_sentence: 汝今見此生死過患耶？」
translation: Do you now see the faults of birth and death?"

source_sentence: 白言：「聖者！
translation: He said, "Sage!

source_sentence: 我今已見。」
translation: I've seen it now."

source_sentence: 又即白言：「願與出家供侍聖者，斷婬怒癡修於梵行。」
translation: He then said, "May I leave home and serve the sages, stop lust, anger, and delusion, and cultivate the religious practice."

source_sentence: 時具壽迦多演那言：「汝可先傳彼語，然後可來出家。」
translation: Kauśānta Yanna then said, "You may first transmit his words, and then you may come and leave home."

source_sentence: 白言：「可爾！」
translation: He said, "That's right!"

source_sentence: 既聞聖者告已，即往彼村殺羊之處，到其人所，告曰：「汝今知不？
translation: After hearing the sage's advice, he went to the village where he had killed the sheep and went to the man and told him, "Do you know now?

source_sentence: 於惡趣中，曾見汝父，遣傳此語：『汝可迴斯殺羊惡業非法之事。』」
translation: In a bad destiny, I once saw your father and sent him this message: 'You may turn back to this bad action of killing sheep, which is unlawful.'"

source_sentence: 彼乃答言：「我父死來經十二年，豈有傳信別生中事，汝從他聞為自見耶？」
translation: They replied, "It's been twelve years since my father's death, but did you hear from someone else and see for yourself what happened in a different life?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「我從惡趣中來。
translation: He answered, "I've come from a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 若不信者，汝父報言：『汝屠羊處地下有一金瓶，穿取其金將為受用，并復時時供養聖者迦多演那食，稱讚我名願罪業消滅。』」
translation: If you don't believe me, your father told you, 'There's a gold vial underneath where you slaughtered the sheep; put it through and take the gold and use it for your enjoyment; and offer food to the sage Kātyāyanā from time to time; praise my name and wish to extinguish your sins.'"

source_sentence: 然此屠兒即穿地下，遂得金瓶，乃知證驗。
translation: Nevertheless, the butcher then penetrated the ground and obtained the gold vase, which was then known to be validated.

source_sentence: 時長者子又即往訪婬逸之子，到已告曰：「我見汝父，令報汝斯事：『我所造業果報成熟，現受眾苦。』」
translation: The elder son then went to visit the promiscuous son, and when he arrived, he told him, "I saw your father and told him to tell you this, 'The results of the actions I've created are ripening, and I'm now subject to numerous sufferings.'"

source_sentence: 斯人答曰：「我父死來，經今十二年。
translation: That man replied, "It's been 12 years since my father died.

source_sentence: 豈從他生中來？
translation: Did he come from another life?'

source_sentence: 為復聞他說耶？
translation: Why do you hear others speak again?

source_sentence: 為自見耶？」
translation: Is it your own view?"

source_sentence: 長者子曰：「我從餓鬼中來，具見斯事。
translation: The elder son said, "I've come from among the hungry ghosts and have seen all these things.

source_sentence: 若不信者，汝父信曰：『向汝事火爐下有二金瓶，汝應穿取受用，及將一分時時供養聖者迦多演那一團之食，稱讚我名願我罪業除滅。』」
translation: If you don't believe me, your father believed me when he said, 'Under the fireplace at your service are two gold vials; put them on, take them, and offer a portion of them to the sage Kātyāyana as a lump of food from time to time, praising my name and wishing for the cessation of my sins.'"

source_sentence: 子即穿地乃見金瓶，始知現驗。
translation: The son then penetrated the ground and saw the gold vase, and then he realized its present realization.

source_sentence: 時長者子又往彼婬女之處告言：「汝復當知，我於惡趣，見汝父母兄嫂及奴，令報汝知，急悔已過惡業之事。」
translation: The elder son then went back to that promiscuous woman and told her, "Again, you should know that I saw your parents, brothers, sisters, and slaves in a bad destiny and made myself known to you as a man who hastily repents of the bad actions he's taken."

source_sentence: 答商主曰：「彼並死來，經今十二年，誰復見聞？
translation: He answered the merchant, "Who has seen and heard of them since their deaths and for 12 years now?

source_sentence: 爾從何處來耶？」
translation: Where have you come from?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「我從地獄中來。
translation: They replied, "I've come from hell.

source_sentence: 若不信者，汝父母言：『我眠臥處床四足下，各有一金瓶，其中并有金杖澡瓶。
translation: If you don't believe me, your parents said, 'Under the four feet of the bed where I sleep and lay, there's a gold vase with a gold staff and a bathing vase in it.

source_sentence: 汝可穿取歡樂受用，及以時時供養聖者人天所奉迦多演那，當稱讚我名願我罪滅。』」
translation: Put it on, enjoy it, and make offerings at appropriate times to the sages, humans, and gods who worship Kātyāyanā, and praise my name and wish for the cessation of my sins.'"

source_sentence: 當即穿地，一如來信。
translation: He then put it on the ground, just as he had believed.

source_sentence: 時長者子笑曰：「人皆信金，不信我語。」
translation: The elder's son then laughed and said, "People believe in gold, but they don't believe my words."

source_sentence: 因笑露齒，女見金齒，乃知斯人是彼長者之子，問曰：「聖者！
translation: He smiled and showed his teeth, and when the woman saw his gold teeth, she knew that he was the son of that elder and asked, "Sage!

source_sentence: 仁豈不是婆羅仙子耶？」
translation: Isn't In the Fairy of Brahmā?"

source_sentence: 報曰：「眾人皆道我是。」
translation: She reported, "Everyone says 'I am.'"

source_sentence: 其女即走往至其家，切報父母。
translation: The woman then went to her house and urgently reported it to her parents.

source_sentence: 父母聞已，當由未信。
translation: When her parents heard this, they probably didn't believe it.

source_sentence: 其長者子自往家中，作謦咳聲。
translation: The elder son went to their home and made a coughing noise.

source_sentence: 父母猜覺，乃知是子，即抱子頭，號聲大哭。
translation: Guessing and realizing it was their son, the parents hugged him by the head and wept loudly.

source_sentence: 父母先盲，因哭眼膜除，得見子面。
translation: The parents, who had first been blind, had their eye membranes removed because of the weeping, and they were able to see their son's face.

source_sentence: 時長者子白父母：「我欲出家，願見賜許。」
translation: The elder son then said to his parents, "I want to leave home and would like to see permission from them."

source_sentence: 父母告曰：「比者為汝眼目雙盲，我等命存已來，不得出家，二俱死後隨汝所欲。」
translation: His parents told him, "Sir, because you're blind in both eyes and eyesight, we haven't been allowed to leave home since our lives began.

source_sentence: 時長者子雖復在家，而常學讀誦，遂證預流果。
translation: Although he was still at home, the elder son always studied and recited the scriptures, and he then realized the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 復為父母說四真諦法，父母聞已以慧金剛杵，摧破二十種薩迦耶見山證預流果。
translation: He also taught his parents the teaching of the four true truths, and after hearing it, his parents used the vajra of wisdom to destroy the twenty types of śākyamuni and realize the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 於後父母二俱身亡。
translation: Both his parents then died.

source_sentence: 于時長者子悲愁離別戀父母故，廣行布施修諸福業已，往詣聖者迦多演那所，頭面頂禮白言：「聖者！
translation: After making a generous donation and cultivating good actions, the elder son went to the sage Kātyāyana, bowed his head and face, and said, "Sage!

source_sentence: 願於善說法律中而為出家，修行梵行并受近圓。」
translation: May he leave home among the well-explained principles, cultivate the religious practice, and attain near-perfection."

source_sentence: 爾時聖者既觀察已，即與億耳出家，而為求寂證一來果。
translation: After observing this, the noble man then renounced the house with a hundred million ears and sought quiescence to realize the fruit of the once-returner.

source_sentence: 時彼住處，是其邊地，少有苾芻，難得受具且為求寂。
translation: At the time, he was staying at a place at the edge of that place where there were few monks who had difficulty accepting the completeness of their religious training and were seeking quiescence.

source_sentence: 所有求寂行法悉已教之，證不還果。
translation: He had taught them all the practices for seeking quiescence and realized the fruit of nonreturn.

source_sentence: 諸佛常法歲二大會，一切苾芻悉皆來集。
translation: At the two annual assemblies of the buddhas' constant teaching, all the monks come to gather.

source_sentence: 言二時者，所為春末及以夏後。
translation: The two seasons we're talking about are late spring and late summer.

source_sentence: 凡有大小聲聞等眾，普皆雲集。
translation: All the śrāvakas and others, great and small, gather in great numbers.

source_sentence: 具壽聖者迦多演那弟子，及諸苾芻等，在於餘處三月安居。
translation: The disciples of the sage Gautama Kātyāyana and the monks stayed at the other place for three months to settle down.

source_sentence: 安居既竟洗浣衣訖，著衣持鉢漸漸遊行，往婆索婆村，方滿十眾。
translation: After they had finished their retreat, they washed their robes and cleaned them, put on their robes and bowls, and gradually traveled to the village of Vātsīpa, where they filled ten crowds.

source_sentence: 時聖者迦多演那，即與億耳近圓。
translation: The sage Kātyāyanā then approached the completion with a hundred million ears.

source_sentence: 既近圓已，所有律行悉皆教學，斷諸煩惱證無學果。
translation: Once he had nearly completed it, he taught all the vinaya practices and ended the afflictions to realize the fruit of post-learners.

source_sentence: 既獲果已，堪受人天上妙供養，如上廣說。
translation: Once they had attained the fruit, they were able to accept the marvelous offerings from the heavens to humans, as explained in detail above.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻等，往聖者迦多演那所白言：「大德！
translation: The monks and nuns then went to the sage Kātyāyana and said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 比住此間，供養聖者，所有事法悉皆作了，今欲禮覲大師世尊。」
translation: I've stayed here, made offerings to the sage, and accomplished all my tasks and teachings, and now I want to pay my respects to the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 聖者報言：「善哉隨去！」
translation: The sage replied, "Good, go along!"

source_sentence: 既蒙許已，嚴持衣鉢，往室羅筏城。
translation: Once he had received permission, he gathered his robe and bowl and went to the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 于時聖者億耳從坐而起，整衣服合掌恭敬，白迦多演那言：「鄔波馱耶！
translation: Upon arriving, the sage Ereka rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, put his palms together in respect, and said to Kātyāyana, "Upāya!

source_sentence: 我有諮白，願見聽許。
translation: I've had some advice, and I'd like to see it and have it accepted.

source_sentence: 我今但見鄔波馱耶，未見世尊。
translation: Now, I've only seen upādhyāya, but I haven't seen the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 雖見法身，未見色身。
translation: Although I've seen the Dharma body, I haven't seen the form body.

source_sentence: 若親教聽我見如來色身相好者，今亦欲去。」
translation: If I had been personally taught to see the Tathāgata's appearance in form, I would want to leave now."

source_sentence: 是時聖者迦多演那告億耳曰：「諸佛如來，難可得見。
translation: The noble Kātyāyanā told Ekṣipatana, "It's difficult to see the Tathāgatas as buddhas.

source_sentence: 時久乃逢，如鄔曇花。
translation: They are like the udumbara flower when you meet them after a long time.

source_sentence: 汝今欲去，宜可知時。」
translation: Now that you want to leave, it's a good idea to know the time."

source_sentence: 迦多演那告言：「汝至世尊所，代我頭面禮足問訊世尊：『少病少惱，起居輕利安樂住不？』
translation: Kātyāyanā told him, "Go to the Bhagavān, bow your head and face at his feet, and ask the Bhagavān, 'Do you have few illnesses and few disturbances, and do you live in comfort and ease?'

source_sentence: 并持五事往白世尊：『婆索婆村，地是邊國，有欲近圓，十眾難得。
translation: He also took five things and went to the Bhagavān, saying, 'Vātsīpa is a country at the edge of the earth that has a desire to approach the perfection, but it's difficult for ten people to get there.

source_sentence: 又彼國人常以水澡洗為淨。
translation: Also, the people of that country always wash themselves with water to purify it.

source_sentence: 其地堅鞕，牛若行時有脚迹，不同諸國地土柔軟。
translation: Their ground is so hard and loose that cattle walking on it will get their feet wet, unlike the ground in other countries where the earth is soft and gentle.

source_sentence: 又東國人用如是臥具，所謂羖羊皮、鹿皮、牛皮等。
translation: Also, people in the eastern land use such bedding as this, which is called ewe's skin, deer skin, and cow skin.

source_sentence: 若有苾芻，與餘苾芻送衣，聞有衣來，而未入手，恐犯過十日捨罪，不知云何？
translation: If a monk gives clothes to another monk and he hears that they've come and haven't put them in his hand, he's afraid he'll commit the sin of giving up more than ten days.

source_sentence: 將此請緣具白世尊，世尊有教，我敬奉行。』」
translation: I will explain these requests to the Bhagavān, and I will respectfully apply myself to his teaching.'"

source_sentence: 是時億耳一心專念，既辭師已，其夜在彼村宿，至明清旦，著衣持鉢漸漸遊行。
translation: Yi Er then concentrated his mind. After leaving his teacher, he stayed overnight in that village until early morning, putting on his robe and carrying his bowl as he traveled gradually.

source_sentence: 乞食已訖，至於食後，別其主人，還臥具竟，執持衣鉢，往室羅筏城，隨路而去。
translation: When he had finished begging for food, he left his master after the meal, returned to his bed, took his robe and bowl, and went to Śrāvastī, following the road.

source_sentence: 經諸村落，方達彼城至逝多林，安置衣鉢洗手足訖，即往頂禮世尊。
translation: He passed through various villages before reaching Jeta's Grove, where he placed his robe and bowl, washed his hands and feet, and went to pay homage to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為諸四眾及諸天、龍、鬼神、國王、大臣、沙門、婆羅門等說法。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke to the four crowds, gods, dragons, spirits, kings, ministers, ascetics, priests, and others.

source_sentence: 佛既遙見億耳從遠方來，而告阿難陀曰：「可於房內與敷億耳床褥臥具。」
translation: When the Buddha saw Ereṣa coming from a distance, he told Ānanda, "You may prepare Ereṣa's bed and bedding in your room."

source_sentence: 阿難奉教，即往敷床臥具。
translation: Ānanda followed his instruction and went to prepare the bedding.

source_sentence: 既敷設已白世尊曰：「願聖知時。」
translation: After it was made, he said to the Bhagavān, "May the sages know when it's time."

source_sentence: 佛既洗足入於房內，右脇而臥，兩足相壘，作光明相，正念當起如是作意。
translation: After washing his feet, the Buddha went into his room, lay down on his right side, put his feet together, made a bright face, and correctly observed that this would be the time to do so.

source_sentence: 爾時億耳，於寺門外，洗足已入房安置，同前右脇而臥，作光明相，念當早起。
translation: At the time, 100,000,000 ears went outside the temple gate, washed his feet, went into his room, and placed himself in the same position as before, lying on his right side, making a bright face, and remembering that he would rise early.

source_sentence: 如是作意，而於夜中，竟無言語，默然而住。
translation: With this intent, he said nothing during the night and stayed there in silence.

source_sentence: 夜欲已過，億耳即便結跏趺坐，直身定意，正念現前。
translation: After the night was over, Ereṣa then sat cross-legged, straightened his body and concentrated his attention, and showed correct mindfulness.

source_sentence: 佛告億耳苾芻：「汝可誦我所說經律，如我成道所說之者。」
translation: The Buddha told Bhaiṣajyaguru, "You may recite the sūtras and vinaya that I've taught you, just as I taught them in my attainment of enlightenment."

source_sentence: 即教誦經，億耳既誦經已，佛即讚言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: He then instructed him to recite the sūtras, and after he had done so, the Buddha praised him, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝所誦經極為清淨微妙。」
translation: The sūtra you've been reciting is extremely pure and subtle."

source_sentence: 時億耳即作是念：「鄔波馱耶！
translation: Yi Yi'er then had this thought, "Upādhyāya!

source_sentence: 令我請者，今正是時。
translation: Now is the right time for me to ask someone to do so.

source_sentence: 如鄔波馱耶所問之事，今應請之。」
translation: Now is the time to ask for something like what (Upādhyāya) asked."

source_sentence: 作是念已，即從座起，頂禮佛足白言：「大德！
translation: After he had this thought, he rose from his seat, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 我住處阿濕婆蘭德伽國婆索婆村，其地邊方，彼有聖者迦多演那，是親教師，稽首頂禮佛足，問訊世尊：『少病少惱，起居輕利安樂住不？
translation: I live in the village of Vāsāpa in Aśvarandeja, and there's a sage there, Kātyāyanā, who is a teacher, prostrates himself at the Buddha's feet, and asks the Bhagavān, 'Do you live with few illnesses and few disturbances, and do you live in comfort and ease?'

source_sentence: 并以五事請問世尊：彼國是邊地，十眾近圓極為難得。
translation: He also asked the Bhagavān about five things: "That country is a border land, and it's extremely difficult to attain the near-perfection of ten groups of people.

source_sentence: 又彼國人，常以洗浴，以為清淨。
translation: Furthermore, the people of that country always bathe themselves in order to purify themselves.

source_sentence: 彼國地土，極惡堅硬，牛蹋足迹，日曬乾已，人行不得，不同餘國。
translation: The ground of that country is so hard and unlike that of other countries, it's worn down by cattle and dried up by the sun, so people can't walk on it.

source_sentence: 彼國常用如是臥具：毛蓐、羊皮、鹿皮、牛皮、羖羊皮，以為臥具。
translation: In that country, these things are often used for bedding: woolen mats, sheepskins, deer skins, cow skins, and ewe skins for bedding.

source_sentence: 若苾芻與餘苾芻送衣，聞有衣來，而未入手，過十日，恐成犯捨，不知云何？』」
translation: If a monk or other monk gives clothes to another monk and he hears that they've come and haven't put them in his hand, after ten days, he's afraid that it will be a violation of the rules of forfeiture, I wonder what it would be?"

source_sentence: 佛告億耳苾芻：「汝所問者，今非是時，我今不說，且置是事。
translation: The Buddha told Bṛhatphala, "This is not the right time for you to ask that question, so I won't tell you now and leave it at that.

source_sentence: 當於眾中問，我於大眾之中為汝決疑。」
translation: You must ask in the midst of the crowd, and I will resolve your doubts for you in the midst of the crowd."

source_sentence: 既至平旦，佛即起來，眾中就座而坐。
translation: Now, at sunrise, the Buddha rose and took his seat among the people.

source_sentence: 佛既坐已，時億耳苾芻即從座起，整理衣服合掌頂禮世尊，白言：「東方邊國婆索婆聚落，聖者迦多演那在彼而住，是我鄔波馱耶，頭面禮佛足，問訊世尊：『少病少惱、起居輕利、安樂住不？
translation: When he had finished sitting, Ikṣvāku rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, put his palms together, and bowed his head to the Bhagavān, saying, "I, Upāya, bowed my head and face to the Buddha's feet and asked the Bhagavān, 'Is he less sick and less distressed, does he live in comfort and ease?'

source_sentence: 彼國邊方，欲受近圓，十眾難得。
translation: In the remote regions of that country, there are ten things that are difficult to obtain when you want to be near and perfect.

source_sentence: 彼國人民，常以水洗浴，便為清淨。
translation: The people of that country always wash themselves with water, and they're purified.

source_sentence: 國內地土極為堅硬，牛行蹋地足迹，日曬乾已，人行不得，不同餘國。
translation: The ground in that country is so hard that cattle walking on it tramples the tracks, and after the sun dries it, people can't walk on it, unlike in other countries.

source_sentence: 國法復用如是臥具，所謂羊毛、羊皮、鹿、牛、羖羊等皮，以為臥具。
translation: The state also uses such bedding as this, which is called wool, sheepskin, deer, cow, ewe, and other skins, for bedding.

source_sentence: 有苾芻遣信與苾芻衣，聞有衣來，其衣未至，便過十日，恐犯捨墮，不知云何？』」
translation: When a monk sends a letter with a monk's robe and he hears that it's coming, but it's been ten days before his robe arrives, he's afraid that he'll violate the rules of forfeiture, so I wonder what happened?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊以此因緣，告諸苾芻曰：「從今已後，聽諸苾芻，於邊方國，持律苾芻五人，得為近圓。
translation: It was for this reason that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "From now on, listen to the monks, in countries in the far reaches of the world, five monks who maintain the precepts may be close to the circle.

source_sentence: 邊方地土惡處，開著一重革屣，不得二重、三重，底若穿破應補。
translation: In the harsh places of the neighboring lands, a monk may wear one pair of leather sandals, not two or three, and if his bottom is torn, he should repair it.

source_sentence: 若苾芻遣信送衣與餘苾芻，彼未得衣，無犯捨罪。」
translation: If a monk sends a faithful gift of clothing to another monk, he won't be guilty of abandoning it if he hasn't yet received it."

source_sentence: 時具壽鄔波離在於眾中，從座而起整理衣服，合掌白佛言：「世尊大德！
translation: Kauśāmbī Ubali then rose from his seat among the crowd, adjusted his robes, put his palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān, great sir!

source_sentence: 向開邊方持律五人近圓，不知從何處以來是邊方處？」
translation: I wonder where the five vinaya-holders who have approached the circle since the opening of the borderlands are from?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「從此東方，有奔荼林，彼有水，名曰奔荼，從此已去名為邊國。
translation: The Buddha said, "From here on the east, there's Pūrṇa Grove, which has water named Pūrṇa, and from here on out it's called a border country.

source_sentence: 南方有國，名攝伐羅佛底，有水亦名攝伐羅佛底，從此已外亦名邊方。
translation: To the south, there's a country named Cephalopodhi, and there's water also named Cephalopodhi, which is also called a border country from here on out.

source_sentence: 西方有國，名窣吐奴，鄔波窣吐奴婆羅門村此外名邊方。
translation: To the west, there's a country named Sutunu, and the village of Upasutunu Brahman is also called a border country.

source_sentence: 北方有山，名嗢尸羅，此山之外，名曰邊方。」
translation: To the north, there's a mountain named Āśīla, and beyond that it's called a border."

source_sentence: 諸苾芻等生疑，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monks and nuns had doubts and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此億耳苾芻，曾作何業？
translation: What kind of activity did this billion-eared monk do?

source_sentence: 生大富貴家，財寶無量，於母胎中，耳上自然有此妙寶耳璫，價直無量。
translation: Born into a wealthy family with measureless possessions, this wonderful jeweled earring of incalculable value naturally attaches to their mother's ear while they're still in the womb.

source_sentence: 復得出家近圓，不見世尊得無學果，斷除煩惱。」
translation: Again, they leave home and approach completion without seeing the Bhagavān attain the fruit of post-learners and are freed from affliction."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「此億耳苾芻，先所作業，自作自受。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "These billion ear monks did something in the past that they themselves received.

source_sentence: 因緣會遇，如暴水流，決定須受。
translation: When they meet for a reason, they're like a raging current that must definitely be received.

source_sentence: 今始會遇，合受斯報，亦非地水火風能令有壞果報，身必自受。
translation: Now, when they first meet, they'll be united in this result, and it's not like earth, water, fire, or wind can cause there to be the result of destruction, which they themselves will surely experience.

source_sentence: 如有頌云：「『假令經百劫，　　所作業不亡，　　因緣會遇時，　　果報還自受。』」
translation: As a verse says, 'Even if it takes a hundred eons for the task to be accomplished without dying, when causes and conditions meet, the result will be felt on its own.'"

source_sentence: 告諸苾芻曰：「乃往過去，於此賢劫中人壽二萬歲時，有佛出世，號迦攝波如來，十號具足，住波羅痆斯國仙人墮處施鹿林中。
translation: He told the monks, "In the distant past, during this good eon when his life was 20,000 years old, a Buddha appeared in the world named Kāśyapa Tathāgata, complete with all ten epithets, and stayed in the deer park of Bārāṇasī where sages fall.

source_sentence: 其國有王，名訖里伽，而為王化，人民熾盛，飲食豐足，無諸衰患，悉皆安樂。
translation: In that country there was a king named Kṛkāla, who was the king's transformation, and the people prospered, ate abundantly, had no trouble, and were all in well-being.

source_sentence: 無賊無畏，一切具足，無所乏少，以法治世。
translation: Without thieves or fear, they have everything they need, and nothing is lacking, so they govern the world.

source_sentence: 彼王有子，名曰善生，立為太子。
translation: The king had a son named Sunasena, who was crowned prince.

source_sentence: 時迦攝波如來化緣既畢，如薪盡火滅而入涅槃。
translation: After the Tathāgata Kāśyapa had finished his career, he ended his fire and entered nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時訖里伽王即取香木以用荼毘，又用牛乳滅火，收拾設利羅，用四種寶造瓶，於四衢中起七寶塔，安置設利羅，高一俱盧舍。
translation: King Kṛkāla then took fragrant wood for the funeral pyre, extinguished the fire with cow's milk, gathered up the śarīra, made vases of four kinds of treasure, and built a seven-jewel stūpa in the middle of four roads to house the śarīra, which was one kuruśa high.

source_sentence: 其國東境所有貢物，盡施於塔。
translation: All the offerings from the eastern border of that country were donated to the stūpa.

source_sentence: 後時其王命終，便立太子為王，即與諸大臣等共撿庫藏其物多少。
translation: When his life ended, the king then installed the crown prince as king, and he and his ministers gathered together to examine the treasury to see how much of it was in storage.

source_sentence: 并見國之東境所出貢物，悉施於塔。
translation: They also saw that all the tribute goods that had come from the eastern border of the country had been given to the stūpa.

source_sentence: 諸臣白王：『先有王所施塔之物，應還取不？』
translation: The ministers said to the king, 'Should we take back the things that the king had previously given to the stūpa?'

source_sentence: 新王答曰：『我父先王所作之事，如釋梵天王，我今豈敢還取斯物。』
translation: The new king answered, 'My father the previous king did as King Śubhavyūha did, how dare I take back this property?'

source_sentence: 然諸臣等皆不信樂佛法，共作是念：『我今當設方便，施塔之物悉還收取。』
translation: However, the ministers didn't believe in the Buddha's teaching, and they all thought, 'Now, I will make a way to return all the things I've given to the stūpa and take them back.'

source_sentence: 即閉城東門，所有財物皆悉不入，其塔彩色脫落，並皆破壞。
translation: They then closed the eastern gate of the city, refused to let in all the property, stripped the stūpa of its color, and destroyed it all.

source_sentence: 「北方有一商主，將諸商人來至此國，於塔傍住。
translation: "To the north, a merchant brought his merchants to this country and stayed near the stūpa.

source_sentence: 爾時商主塔所禮敬，見塔破壞，復見一女人，無有男女灑掃供養。
translation: When the merchant worshipped the tower, he saw it destroyed and also saw a woman with no men or women to cleanse and offer support to.

source_sentence: 然彼女人，既見迦攝波如來、應、正等覺，於彼佛所發心受學。
translation: That woman, however, had seen the Kāśyapa Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Enlightened One, and had arisen the intention to train with that Buddha.

source_sentence: 商主問女曰：『此是誰塔？』
translation: The merchant owner asked the woman, 'Who is this stūpa?'

source_sentence: 女便廣說因緣：『此是迦攝波佛塔。』
translation: The woman then explained the cause and conditions in detail, 'This is Kāśyapa's stūpa.'

source_sentence: 商主聞已，心生歡喜，即脫耳璫奉彼女人，令賣取直用修營塔：『我若迴還，當更布施。』
translation: When the merchant heard this, his heart rejoiced, so he took off his ear and gave it to the woman in disgrace, telling her to sell it and use it directly to build the stūpa: 'If I return, I'll make another offering.'

source_sentence: 女人得已，即便莊嚴。
translation: After the woman got it, she even adorned it.

source_sentence: 商主迴還，到彼塔邊瞻仰無盡，即便發心，更造寶蓋幢幡以用供養，如是發願：『我今供養此迦攝波如來塔所有善根，願我當來生處，常得富貴尊高。
translation: When the merchant returned, he went to the stūpa and looked up at it endlessly. Even then, he had the intention to build another jeweled canopy, banners, and banners to make offerings to it, and he vowed, 'Now that I've made offerings to the good roots of this Kāśyapa Tathāgata's stūpa, may I always attain wealth and honor in my future birthplace.

source_sentence: 於當佛所，願得出家，斷除煩惱，證無學果。』」
translation: In the future, I hope to leave home, end the afflictions, and realize the fruit of post-learners.'"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「其商主者，豈異人乎？
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Is that merchant owner someone else?

source_sentence: 即此億耳苾芻是。
translation: "This is the billion ear monk.

source_sentence: 由供養迦攝波佛塔故，生生常得富貴家生，於母胎中，便有寶耳璫珠自然在耳。
translation: Because he makes offerings to Kāśyapa's stūpa, he'll be born into a wealthy family and have the precious earrings and beads naturally placed in his mother's womb.

source_sentence: 復願當來出家，斷除煩惱，得阿羅漢果。
translation: They also hope to leave home in the future, end their afflictions, and attain the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 復於母所，出惡言故，由斯業力，見諸地獄。」
translation: Again, because of this activity, I'll see the hells because of the bad words I uttered at my mother's place."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「若作白業得白果報，若作黑業得黑報，雜業雜報。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "If you do white actions, you'll get the results of white actions, and if you do black actions, you'll get the results of black actions, which are a mixture of actions and mixed results.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 當離雜、黑業，當修白業。」
translation: You must part with mixed, black karma and cultivate white karma."

source_sentence: 告諸苾芻：「此是我教。」
translation: He told the monks, "This is my teaching."

source_sentence: 諸苾芻等聞佛說已，歡喜奉行。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, the monks rejoiced and handed it down.

translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya-leather-works, Volume 1
